Processor Settings

Figure 7-13 Processor

Table 7-6 Processor Parameters

Field Name

Description

Turbo Boost

The processor uses Intel Turbo Boost Technology to automatically increase its frequency depending on power, temperature, or voltage specifications.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Enhanced Intel Speedstep

The processor uses Enhanced Intel SpeedStep Technology to adjust processor voltage and core frequency.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Hyper Threading

The processor uses Intel Hyper-Threading Technology that allows multi-threaded software applications to execute threads in parallel within each processor.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default

Core Multi Processing

The state of logical processor cores in a package can be set. Set any one of the following values.

 • all

 • 1 through 10

 • Platform Default

Execute Disabled Bit

This setting helps to prevent damage, worm propagation, and certain classes of malicious buffer overflow attacks.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default

Virtualization Technology

The processor uses Intel Virtualization Technology that allows a platform to run multiple operating systems and applications in independent partitions.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Hardware Prefetcher

The processor allows the Intel hardware prefetcher to fetch streams of data and instruction from memory into the unified second-level cache when necessary.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Adjacent Catch Line Prefetcher

The processor fetches cache lines in even/odd pairs instead of fetching just the required line.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

DCU Streamer Prefetch

The processor uses the DCU Streamer Prefetch mechanism to analyze historical cache access patterns and preload the most relevant lines in the L1 cache.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

DCU IP Prefetch

The processor uses the DCU IP Prefetch mechanism to analyze historical cache access patterns and preload the most relevant lines in the L1 cache.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Direct Cache Access

Allows processors to increase I/O performance by placing data from I/O devices directly into the processor cache, and helps to reduce cache misses.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Processor C State

The system can enter a power savings mode during idle periods.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Processor C1 E

Allows the processor to transition to its minimum frequency upon entering C1, and does not take effect until you have rebooted the server.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Processor C3 Report

The processor sends the C3 report to the operating system.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Processor C6 Report

The processor sends the C6 report to the operating system.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

Processor C7 Report

The processor sends the C7 report to the operating system.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

CPU Performance

Sets the CPU performance profile for the server. Select any of the options such as enterprise, high-throughput, and hpc.

Max Variable MTRR Settings

Allows you to select the number of mean time to repair (MTRR) variables. Select any values for the BIOS such as auto-max, 8, and Platform Default.

Local X2 APC

Allows you to set the type of Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) architecture. Select xapic, x2apic, auto, and Platform Default.

Power Technology

Enables to configure the CPU Power Management Settings. Select Disabled, Energy Efficient, Performance, Custom, and Platform Default.

Energy Performance

Allows you to determine system performance or energy efficiency on the server. Select options such as performance, balanced-performance, balanced-energy, energy-efficient, and Platform Default.

Frequency Floor Override

The CPU is allowed to drop below the maximum non-turbo frequency when idle.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default.

P-STATE Coordination

Allows to define the models the way BIOS communicates the P-state support model to the operating system. Select HW_ALL, SW_ALL, SW_ANY, and Platform Default.

DRAM Clock Throttling

Allows you to tune the system settings between the memory bandwidth and power consumption. Select Balanced, Performance, Energy Efficient, and Platform Default.

Channel Interleaving

The CPU divides memory blocks and spreads contiguous portions of data across interleaved channels to enable simultaneous read operations. Select any of the following options:

 • Auto

 • 1-way

 • 2-way

 • 3-way

 • 4-way

 • Platform Default

Rank Interleaving

The CPU interleaves physical ranks of memory so that one rank can be accessed while another is being refreshed. Select any of the following options:

 • Auto

 • 1-way

 • 2-way

 • 3-way

 • 4-way

 • Platform Default

Demand Scrub

The system corrects single bit memory errors encountered when the CPU or I/O makes a demand read.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default

Petrol Scrub

The system actively searches for, and corrects, single bit memory errors even in unused portions of the memory on the server.

Upon your requirement, select disabled, enabled or Platform Default
